page.title: 01Tilstock and District
page.content: Tilstock is an ecclesiastical parish, formed out of the parishes of Prees and Whitchurch on October 15th 1844. Tilstock stands on the B5476 road from Whitchurch to Wem, 2 1/2mls. to the south of Whitchurch and 6 1/2mls.to the north of Wem. The village is also on the Chester and Shrewsbury road, 3mls.north of Prees and 3 mls. south of Whitchurch the parish is crossed by the Shrewsbury and Crewe branch line of British Rail. There are also minor roads leading east to Prees Heath and Ash and west to Alkington. This is called Hollins Lane and a road going roughly in a south westerly direction to Hollinwood and Whixall. Tilstock is more a farming area than industrial area as the nearest industry is in Whitchurch or Shrewsbury. The core of the village is centred around the village hall,the shop /postoffice,
